title: It is even possible to build and code YOUR own credit card? - Quora

response.answer_text: No - but with one exception The bit of plastic is just a simple way of accessing a loan account. The loan account does not exist on the card itself. It’s at the financial institution that gave you the card - on their servers, and in their accounting system. The only way to create your own credit card would also be to create your own credit card company, create the loan account and get approval from one of the big card networks, like Visa or Mastercard so the payment can be processed. I’m guessing a bit here, but I suspect the process would cost millions. All to get a credit card. As financial companies, including credit card firms, are very highly regulated, you would still have to pay the company back for your personal expenditure.
As a practical matter in today’s world, no. Back before electronic processing it might have been possible to make one using a commercially available card printer (expensive still).
